parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A young man, youth, an attendant. From the same as neanias; a youth.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To accompany, follow together with. From sun and akoloutheo; to accompany.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From peri and ballo; to throw all around, i.e. Invest.
Fine linen, a linen cloth. Of uncertain origin; byssos, i.e. Bleached linen.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Rarely: stark-naked; generally: wearing only the under-garment; bare, open, manifest; mere. Of uncertain affinity; nude.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
